intro: Micromeria ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and compact growth habit. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
